user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of SHA1Input:
```c
static enum SHA1_RESULT
SHA1Input (struct SHA1Context *context, const unsigned char *message_array,
           unsigned length)
{
  if (! length)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_SUCCESS;
  }
  if (! context || ! message_array)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_NULL;
  }
  if (context->computed)
  {
    context->corrupted = 1;
    return SHA1_RESULT_STATE_ERROR;
  }
  if (context->corrupted)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_STATE_ERROR;
  }
  while (length-- && ! context->corrupted)
  {
    context->message_block[context->message_block_index++]
      = (*message_array & 0xFF);
    context->length_low += 8;
    if (context->length_low == 0)
    {
      context->length_high++;
      if (context->length_high == 0)
      {
        context->corrupted = 1;
      }
    }
    if (context->message_block_index == 64)
    {
      SHA1ProcessMessageBlock (context);
    }
    message_array++;
  }
  return SHA1_RESULT_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (context->corrupted)
  {
    return SHA1_RESULT_STATE_ERROR;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The fragment is reachable when context is non-NULL, message_array is non-NULL, length != 0, context->computed is false, and context->corrupted is true (i.e. corrupted was set prior to this call). In that case the second check returns SHA1_RESULT_STATE_ERROR. Therefore the code is not unreachable.
